EINSTEIN PERSONALIZATION
Einstein Personalization and Data Cloud Setup

Personalization is a Customer 360 application that connects and provides personalized experiences across clouds. Before using this app, you must first define the appropriate Einstein Personalization permissions, and install and configure Data Cloud to work with Einstein Personalization data model objects.

Learn About Data Cloud and Einstein Personalization
To generate and present unique, personalized content experiences, the Einstein Personalization app uses Data Cloud profile and item data graphs, calculated insights, segments, and real time behavioral data.
Set Up Permissions and related Prerequisites
Create and configure user permission sets to associate them with Einstein Personalization users. Also, enable the required permissions and CRM Analytics so the users can access and create the Personalization Intelligence app for managing Personalization pipeline analytics.
Data Cloud Setup Prerequisites
For Einstein Personalization to function, Data Cloud must be set up and configured. The following are the prerequisites for setting up Einstein Personalization to work with Data Cloud.
Add the Web SDK with the Personalization Module to Your Site
Einstein Personalization requires the use of the Data Cloud Web SDK with the personalization module.
Install Einstein Personalization Data Kit and Components
To assist with Data Cloud setup, install the Einstein Personalization data kit that and use it to create and deploy some of the required components. Before you can use the data kit, you must first install it into your Data Cloud org. You can install the data kit from AppExchange or using a URL.
Use the Data Kit to Install and Deploy Data Streams and Calculated Insights
The Einstein Personalization Data Kit contains bundles for installing the ingestion API and Salesforce CRM data streams. It also provides a bundle for installing two required calculated insights.
Configure Einstein Personalization Attribution Objects
The data kit installs five standard data model objects (DMOs). However, to gather and optionally view Einstein Personalization attribution data, you must also install four custom attribution DMOs from CSV files.
Map Data Model Objects for Einstein Personalization
Einstein Personalization requires that you install certain data model objects in Data Cloud. Some standard objects exist in your org and are listed here for reference. To prepare your data for the identity resolution process, map the data lake objects (DLOs) created by your data streams or template CSV files to the corresponding data model objects (DMOs).
Add Custom Fields to the Goods Product Data Model Object
For retail configurations where you plan to use the maximize revenue recommender, make sure to add these two fields to the Goods Product DMO for use by Einstein Personalization.
Set Up Real-Time Identity Resolution for Einstein Personalization
Real-time identity resolution matches information about active end users to a unified profile object, consolidating profile data from different sources. Each unified profile contains all unique contact point values from all sources, providing a comprehensive view of each individual. Combining real-time identity resolution and Einstein Personalization, you can deliver personalized content to individuals using your app or website within milliseconds.
Using Data Graphs With Einstein Personalization
Einstein Personalization requires two Data Cloud data graphs–a profile data graph, and an item data graph. The profile data graph provides real-time data to Einstein Personalization for determining personalization eligibility. The item data graph provides data to Einstein Personalization recommenders that are used to generate recommendations.
Define Segments for Einstein Personalization
You can define real-time segments based on customer interactions to deliver immediate responses. For example, use segments to assess user engagement in real time to segment customers based on interests and preferences. You can also define standard segments for use in determining what products you want to recommend to individuals. For example, you can exclude products that users have purchased in the last 15 days from a recommendation list.
Configure Data Cloud Insights for Einstein Personalization
You can configure Data Cloud insights to define and calculate multidimensional metrics for use by Einstein Personalization. Using insights, you can define specialized metrics to provide more in-depth views into customer activity, better understand site or app interaction, or gauge customer satisfaction.
Data Graph and Insight Settings for Using the Maximize Revenue Recommendation
Use the instructions in this section to supplement your Data Cloud data graph and calculated insight setup configuration for Einstein Personalization to use the Maximize Revenue goal-based recommender. To use the Maximize Revenue goal-based recommender, you must add certain objects and fields that the recommender uses during training.
